observershipNotes: The International Post Graduate Observership Course is offered for four weeks in Internal Medicine, Infectious Diseases, and Pathology/Laboratory Medicine. However, the Department of Medicine and the Department of Psychiatry specifically state that they do not offer observerships. For visiting international medical students, electives are available to a select number from established partner institutions. It is recommended to contact the VOE email for any potential opportunities for IMGs.

eligibility.additionalNotes: Contact program coordinator for the most up-to-date eligibility requirements. Requirements are subject to change.

description: West Virginia University School of Medicine offers a clinical observership program in Internal Medicine for international medical graduates (IMGs). This program provides hands-on exposure to US clinical practice, patient care workflows, and interdisciplinary teamwork in a Richmond-based setting.
observershipNotes: The West Virginia University School of Medicine is primarily located in Morgantown, West Virginia, with regional campuses in other parts of West Virginia. There is no evidence of a West Virginia University School of Medicine Program located in Richmond, Virginia. The major academic medical center in Richmond is Virginia Commonwealth University (VCU) Health.
